page.title: 12ST.CLEMENT'S CHURCH
page.content: In 1977 the church was declared redundant and leased to Adventure Unlimited,a church sponsored trust. During the Middle Ages the church was a stopping place for Canterbury Pilgrims before they crossed the Thames.Now it is surrounded by industry.The huge Proctor & Gamble plant towers above it.On the other side is Thurrock Power Station.Close by is a Ford motor plant,DAF Trucks, Blue Circle Cement,Thermalite,Bowater Scott and a number of haulage companies.this has been called the most heavily industrialised square mile in Britain. It is known as "The Ark"and is a community hobby centre where young people can make things for others-invalid ramps for public buildings,toy repairs and furniture restoration.
